00024 Recognizer::Recognizer (const std::string &path) : texts_(std::vector<Text>(0)), statistics_(std::vector<Statistics>(0))
00025 {
00026     // Load image from disk
00027     std::vector<Magick::Image> images;
00028     Magick::readImages( &images, path );
00029     
00030     Magick::Image image = images.at(0);
00031     
00032     // Store the image dimensions
00033     width_  = image.columns();
00034     height_ = image.rows();
00035     
00036     // Load image into the internal vector
00037     loadImage(image);
00038 };

00062 void Recognizer::obtainText ()
00063 {
00064     obtainText(0, 0, height_, width_);
00065 };

00072 void Recognizer::obtainText (const std::vector<ClipLocation> &coordinates)
00073 {
00074     std::vector<ClipLocation>::const_iterator coordinatesIterator;
00075      
00076     for ( coordinatesIterator = coordinates.begin(); coordinatesIterator not_eq coordinates.end(); ++coordinatesIterator )
00077     {
00078         unsigned int x      = (*coordinatesIterator).x();
00079         unsigned int y      = (*coordinatesIterator).y();
00080         unsigned int height = (*coordinatesIterator).height();
00081         unsigned int width  = (*coordinatesIterator).width();
00082         
00083         obtainText(x, y, height, width);
00084     }
00085 };

00094 void Recognizer::obtainText (const unsigned int &x, const unsigned int &y, unsigned int &height, unsigned int &width)
00095 {
00096     // Test the upper left-most pixel X coordinate is inside the source image
00097     if ( (x >= height_) or (x < 0) )
00098         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The x coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00099         
00100     // Test the upper left-most pixel Y coordinate is inside the source image
00101     if ( (y >= width_) or (y < 0) )
00102         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The y coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00103     
00104     // Truncate the clip's height if it is higher than the image
00105     if ( (height > height_) or (height < 0) )
00106         height = height_;
00107         
00108     // Truncate the clip's width if it is wider than the image
00109     if ( (width > width_) or (width < 0) )
00110         width = width_;
00111         
00112     // Truncate the clip's height if it is outside the source image
00113     if ((x + height) > height_)
00114         height = height_ - x;
00115     
00116     // Truncate the clip's width if it is outside the source image
00117     if ((y + width) > width_)
00118         width = width_ - y;
00119     
00120     
00121     // Creates the clip
00122     Clip clip(image_, width_, x, y, height, width);
00123     
00124 
00125     //
00126     // Preprocessing stage
00127     //
00128     Preprocessor preprocessor;
00129     std::cout << "Background reference level   : " << static_cast<unsigned int>(preprocessor.findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip)) << std::endl;
00130     std::cout << "Optimal threshold            : " << static_cast<unsigned int>(preprocessor.computeOptimalThreshold(clip)) << std::endl << std::endl;
00131     preprocessor.removeIsolatedNoise(clip);
00132     
00133     
00134     //
00135     // Segmentation stage
00136     //
00137     Segmenter segmenter;
00138     segmenter.applyThreshold(clip, preprocessor.optimalThreshold(), preprocessor.backgroundReferenceGrayLevel());
00139     updateImage(clip);
00140     
00141     segmenter.findShapes(clip);
00142     std::cout << "Shapes found                 : " << segmenter.shapes().size() << std::endl << std::endl;
00143     
00144     for ( unsigned int k = 0; k < segmenter.shapes().size(); ++k )
00145     {
00146         std::cout << "Shape #" << k << std::endl;
00147         Shape shape(segmenter.shapes().at(k));
00148         
00149         unsigned int x = shape.topPixel().first;
00150         unsigned int y = shape.leftPixel().second;
00151         
00152         unsigned int xBorder = shape.bottomPixel().first;
00153         unsigned int yBorder = shape.rightPixel().second;
00154         
00155         std::cout << "  >> X      : " << x << std::endl;
00156         std::cout << "  >> Y      : " << y << std::endl;
00157         std::cout << "  >> X limit: " << xBorder << std::endl;
00158         std::cout << "  >> Y limit: " << yBorder << std::endl;
00159         std::cout << "  >> Height : " << shape.height() << std::endl;
00160         std::cout << "  >> Width  : " << shape.width() << std::endl;
00161         
00162         Magick::Image img( Magick::Geometry(shape.width(), shape.height()), "white" );
00163         
00164         // Convert the external image into a grayscale colorspace
00165         img.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00166 
00167         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00168         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00169         img.modifyImage();
00170 
00171         // Allocate pixel view
00172         Magick::Pixels view(img);
00173         Magick::PixelPacket *originPixel = view.get(0, 0, shape.width(), shape.height());
00174 
00175         // Copy the current data into the external image
00176         for ( unsigned int i = x; i <= xBorder; ++i )
00177         {
00178             for ( unsigned int j = y; j <= yBorder; ++j )
00179             {
00180                 *originPixel++ = Magick::ColorGray ( static_cast<double>(image_[i * width_ + j]) / 255.0 );
00181             }
00182         }
00183 
00184         // Synchronize changes to the image
00185         view.sync();
00186         img.syncPixels();
00187         
00188         std::ostringstream o;
00189         if (!(o << k))
00190              throw NessieException ("Cannot convert unsigned int to string");
00191 
00192         img.write("shape" + o.str() + ".png");
00193     }
00194     
00195     
00196     //
00197     // Classification stage
00198     //
00199     
00200     
00201     // Gather execution times from each stage and set the statistical data
00202     Statistics stats;
00203     
00204     stats.backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime( preprocessor.backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime() );
00205     stats.optimalThresholdComputingTime( preprocessor.optimalThresholdComputingTime() );
00206     stats.noiseRemovalTime( preprocessor.noiseRemovalTime() );
00207     
00208     stats.thresholdingTime( segmenter.thresholdingTime() );
00209     stats.shapesFindingTime( segmenter.shapesFindingTime() );
00210     
00211     statistics_.push_back(stats);
00212 };

00219 void Recognizer::writeExternalImage (Magick::Image &externalImage) const
00220 {
00221     // Test if the image is empty to create a new one
00222     if ( (externalImage.rows() == 0) and (externalImage.columns() == 0) )
00223         externalImage = Magick::Image(Magick::Geometry(width_, height_), "white");
00224     
00225     
00226     // Assume the internal image dimensions are at least greater or equal to the external image dimensions
00227     unsigned int rows = height_, columns = width_;
00228     
00229     
00230     // Test the external image is lower than the internal image
00231     if ( externalImage.rows() < height_ )
00232         rows = externalImage.rows();
00233     
00234     // Test the external image is narrower than the internal image
00235     if ( externalImage.columns() < width_ )
00236         columns = externalImage.columns();
00237     
00238     
00239     // Convert the external image into a grayscale colorspace
00240     externalImage.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00241         
00242     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00243     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00244     externalImage.modifyImage();
00245 
00246     // Allocate pixel view
00247     Magick::Pixels view(externalImage);
00248     Magick::PixelPacket *originPixel = view.get(0, 0, columns, rows);
00249     Magick::PixelPacket *pixel;
00250     
00251     // Copy the current data into the external image
00252     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < view.rows(); ++i )
00253     {
00254         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < view.columns(); ++j )
00255         {
00256             pixel = originPixel + (i * view.columns()) + j;
00257             
00258             *pixel = Magick::ColorGray ( static_cast<double>(image_[(i * columns) + j]) / 255.0 );
00259         }
00260     }
00261     
00262     // Synchronize changes to the image
00263     view.sync();
00264     externalImage.syncPixels();
00265 };

00273 void Recognizer::loadImage (Magick::Image &image)
00274 {
00275     // Reserve enough space
00276     image_.reserve(height_ * width_);
00277     image_.resize(height_ * width_);
00278     
00279     // Convert the image into grayscale colorspace
00280     image.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00281     
00282     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image
00283     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00284     image.modifyImage();
00285     
00286     // Allocate pixel view
00287     Magick::Pixels view(image);
00288     Magick::PixelPacket *pixels = view.get(0, 0, width_, height_);
00289     
00290     // Copy the image into the internal data structure
00291     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < height_; ++i )
00292     {
00293         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < width_; ++j )
00294         {
00295             Magick::ColorGray grayLevel(*pixels++);
00296 
00297             image_.at(i * width_ + j) = static_cast<unsigned char>( round(grayLevel.shade() * 255.0) );
00298         }
00299     }   
00300 };

00303 
00308 void Recognizer::updateImage (const Clip &clip)
00309 {
00310     unsigned int clipBottomBorder   = clip.row()    + clip.height();
00311     unsigned int clipLeftBorder     = clip.column() + clip.width();
00312     
00313     for ( unsigned int i = clip.row(); i < clipBottomBorder; ++i )
00314     {
00315         for ( unsigned int j = clip.column(); j < clipLeftBorder; ++j )
00316         {
00317             image_.at(i * width_ + j) = clip(i, j);
00318         }
00319     }
00320 };
